speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: SCENE III. The same. Before the gates.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: The Governor and some Citizens on the walls; the English forces below. Enter KING HENRY and his train

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: How yet resolves the governor of the town?

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: This is the latest parle we will admit;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Therefore to our best mercy give yourselves;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Or like to men proud of destruction

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Defy us to our worst: for, as I am a soldier,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: A name that in my thoughts becomes me best,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: If I begin the battery once again,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: I will not leave the half-achieved Harfleur

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Till in her ashes she lie buried.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: The gates of mercy shall be all shut up,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And the flesh'd soldier, rough and hard of heart,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: In liberty of bloody hand shall range

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: With conscience wide as hell, mowing like grass

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Your fresh-fair virgins and your flowering infants.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: What is it then to me, if impious war,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Array'd in flames like to the prince of fiends,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Do, with his smirch'd complexion, all fell feats

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Enlink'd to waste and desolation?

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: What is't to me, when you yourselves are cause,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: If your pure maidens fall into the hand

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Of hot and forcing violation?

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: What rein can hold licentious wickedness

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: When down the hill he holds his fierce career?

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: We may as bootless spend our vain command

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Upon the enraged soldiers in their spoil

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: As send precepts to the leviathan

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: To come ashore. Therefore, you men of Harfleur,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Take pity of your town and of your people,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Whiles yet my soldiers are in my command;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Whiles yet the cool and temperate wind of grace

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: O'erblows the filthy and contagious clouds

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Of heady murder, spoil and villany.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: If not, why, in a moment look to see

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: The blind and bloody soldier with foul hand

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Defile the locks of your shrill-shrieking daughters;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Your fathers taken by the silver beards,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And their most reverend heads dash'd to the walls,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Your naked infants spitted upon pikes,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Whiles the mad mothers with their howls confused

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Do break the clouds, as did the wives of Jewry

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: At Herod's bloody-hunting slaughtermen.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: What say you? will you yield, and this avoid,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Or, guilty in defence, be thus destroy'd?

speaker: GOVERNOR
text_entry: Our expectation hath this day an end:

speaker: GOVERNOR
text_entry: The Dauphin, whom of succors we entreated,

speaker: GOVERNOR
text_entry: Returns us that his powers are yet not ready

speaker: GOVERNOR
text_entry: To raise so great a siege. Therefore, great king,

speaker: GOVERNOR
text_entry: We yield our town and lives to thy soft mercy.

speaker: GOVERNOR
text_entry: Enter our gates; dispose of us and ours;

speaker: GOVERNOR
text_entry: For we no longer are defensible.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Open your gates. Come, uncle Exeter,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Go you and enter Harfleur; there remain,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And fortify it strongly 'gainst the French:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Use mercy to them all. For us, dear uncle,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: The winter coming on and sickness growing

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Upon our soldiers, we will retire to Calais.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: To-night in Harfleur we will be your guest;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: To-morrow for the march are we addrest.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Flourish. The King and his train enter the town
